thread.title: Tauck launches first exotics brochure for UK market
thread.title_full: Tauck launches first exotics brochure for UK market

title: Tauck launches first exotics brochure for UK market
text:
Tauck launches first exotics brochure for UK market Tauck launches first exotics brochure for UK market TRAVEL company Tauck is launching its first exotics brochure in the UK, featuring a luxury small ship cruises to some of the most unspoilt corners of the world. PUBLISHED: 19:29, Fri, Aug 28, 2015 | UPDATED: 19:37, Fri, Aug 28, 2015 GETTY The Great Barrier Reef in Australia is one of the world's most unique sights 
The American holiday firm started with coach tours in the 1920s and still offers land-based escorted holidays with a difference, such as their new family Tauck Bridges range that “never settle for ordinary”. 
While several firms specialise in small ship cruises and expedition cruises, a signature feature of Tauck is its excursions. 
The company claims it gets Tauck travellers closer to animals and plants they encounter on the way, through unique access to cutting-edge night-vision filmmaking equipment and underwater cameras, plus motion-activated camera traps and long-range directional microphones. 
Guests can also view specially-made film vignettes of their destinations, produced and directed for Tauck by some of the world’s best international filmmakers. 
Steve Spivak, Tauck Vice President, said: “This is our first exotics brochure for the UK market and it will have immediate appeal for British travellers who have their eye on something different and special in hard-to-reach locations around the globe. 
“There’s an inspiring range of exclusive itineraries across Antarctica, Asia, Africa, the Americas, the Middle East and Australia, and the insider access you get on a Tauck tour simply isn’t available anywhere else.” Related articles Top 10 bars for a night out in Australia’s vibrant city of Adelaide 
Steve said Tauck’s partnership with international filmmakers was proving to be hugely popular, with tours selling out in record time. Being able to see the best nature film footage with insights and voiceovers from experts is giving Tauck guests added context and a fresh perspective on the natural wonders they’re exploring, and bringing them into more intimate contact with their surroun Steve Spivak, Tauck Vice President 
“What were already exclusive trips are now even more dynamic and interactive,” he said. 
“Being able to see the best nature film footage with insights and voiceovers from experts is giving Tauck guests added context and a fresh perspective on the natural wonders they’re exploring, and bringing them into more intimate contact with their surroundings.” 
Bridges Family Trips include the eight-days Galapagos: Wildlife Wonderland expedition cruise with four nights on Santa Cruz II for £2,955 per person not including international flights. 
Also new for 2016 are Cruising Down Under – Eastbound and Westbound, for £7,930 per person not including international flights. 
The two 19-day Australia and New Zealand packages include nine days onboard the luxurious and extremely stylish Le Soleal followed by land excursions such as flying to Cairns to meet crocodiles then spend a day at the Great Barrier Reef before exploring the rainforest then flying to Sydney. 
Family-owned Tauck has won more than 100 awards and offers more than 100 land and cruise holidays. 
For more information go to www.tauck.co.uk . Related articles
